assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: HiFiasm v. 0.16.1 + galaxy1; purge_dups v. 1.2.5 + galaxy3

bioprojects.title: Plains spadefoot toad (Spea bombifrons) genome, aSpeBom1, alternate haplotype
Plains spadefoot toad (Spea bombifrons) genome, aSpeBom1

description.comment: The plains spadefoot toad (Spea bombifrons) ranges from southwestern Canada, the Great Plains of the western United States, and into northern Mexico. Like other species of spadefoot toads, they get their name from a spade-like projections on their hind legs which allow them to dig into sandy soils (from Wikipedia entry). This sample from a female collected in Anton, Colorado. The sample was procured by Karin Pfenning with coordination help from Andrew Crawford and used to generate a high-quality reference genome for the Vertebrate Genomes Project (VGP). Sequencing and genome assembly were conducted at the Vertebrate Genomes Lab (VGL) at the Rockefeller University, led by Olivier Fedrigo and Erich D. Jarvis.
description.title: Animal sample from Spea bombifrons (plains spadefoot toad) for VGP reference genome, aSpeBom1
